channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 10 essential books about Jimmy Carter
item.description: Throughout his lifetime, Jimmy Carter took on many titles: 39th President of the United States, Nobel Peace Prize winner, philanthropist, humanitarian...

item.title: Jimmy Carter, the 39th US president, has died at 100
Jimmy Carter: Many evolutions for a centenarian ‘citizen of the world’
item.description: The 39th and longest-lived U.S. president, James Earl Carter Jr., died Sunday at the age of 100. His life ended where it began, in Plains, Georgia.

item.title: Five charged in connection with Liam Payne's death, reports say
item.description: The One Direction star died in October after falling from a third-floor hotel balcony in Buenos Aires.

item.title: Dozens die in Ethiopia after lorry with wedding guests falls into river
item.description: It is thought the truck, which was reportedly carrying several wedding guests, was overloaded.

item.title: Jimmy Carter's challenges mirror those faced by Biden
item.description: From Afghanistan to climate change, Carter's presidency charted the course for future US presidents.

item.title: Carlsen to rejoin chess championship after jeans dispute resolved
item.description: The world champion quit the tournament on Friday after being told he had breached the dress code.

item.title: Nine million workers are getting a raise on January 1. Here's where.
item.description: The federal minimum has held at $7.25 an hour since 2009, but an increasing number of states are upping their base pay for workers.
